derivation: middle voice from G1722 (ἐγκομβόομαι) and (to gird);
strongs_def: to engirdle oneself (for labor), i.e. figuratively (the apron as being a badge of servitude) to wear (in token of mutual deference)
outline: 1. knot or band by which two things are fastened together, to fasten or gird one's self
